* [[andLinux]], A Linux distribution running on Microsoft Windows natively.
* Elbuntu is based on the [[Enlightenment (window manager)|Enlightenment]] 17 desktop environment, which delivers high performance with an enhanced graphical user interface that is flexible and creates a rich visual experience.{{Fact|date=April 2008}}

* [[Fluxbuntu]] is a light-weight, standards-compliant, Ubuntu-based Linux distribution featuring the [[Fluxbox]] window manager. The projectâs primary goal is to develop an operating system that would run on a wide range of mobile devices and computers, both low-end and high-end. Recently since they started development on the [[PowerPC]] Architecture, they also started development on support for the Sony Playstation 3.

The projectâs primary goal is to develop an operating system that would run on a wide range of mobile devices and computers, both low-end and high-end. Recently since they started development on the [[PowerPC]] Architecture, they also started development on support for the Sony Playstation 3.
* [[Freespire]] incorporates [[proprietary software|proprietary]] hardware drivers and software. It also uses the [[KDE]] desktop rather than [[GNOME]].
* [[Freespire]] incorporates [[proprietary software|proprietary]] hardware drivers and software. It also uses the [[KDE]] desktop rather than [[GNOME]].
* [[gNewSense]] is designed for users who wish to use only [[free software]]. It is officially supported and recommended by the [[Free Software Foundation]]. The project has also produced a set of scripts that allow anyone to create a free distribution.

* [[Gnoppix]], intended to offer the GNOME desktop environment on a Live CD. Discontinued.
* [[Goobuntu]] is a Linux distribution based on Ubuntu that [[Google]] uses internally. It is not released outside Google.
* [[Goobuntu]] is a Linux distribution based on Ubuntu that [[Google]] uses internally. It is not released outside Google.
* [[gOS (Linux distribution)| gOS]] uses the [[Enlightenment (window manager)|Enlightenment window manager]], featuring [[Google Apps]] and other web-based applications.

* Greenie is a Linux distribution based on Ubuntu and Kiwi and prepared for users in Slovakia and Czech Republic

Line 58: Line 62:
* [[nUbuntu]] or Network Ubuntu is a project to take the existing Ubuntu distribution and remaster it as a [[LiveCD]] and Full Install with tools needed for [[Penetration test|penetration-testing]] servers and networks. The main idea is to keep Ubuntuâs ease of use and mix it with popular penetration testing tools. Besides usage for network and server testing, nUbuntu will be made to be a desktop distribution for advanced Linux users.
* [[nUbuntu]] or Network Ubuntu is a project to take the existing Ubuntu distribution and remaster it as a [[LiveCD]] and Full Install with tools needed for [[Penetration test|penetration-testing]] servers and networks. The main idea is to keep Ubuntuâs ease of use and mix it with popular penetration testing tools. Besides usage for network and server testing, nUbuntu will be made to be a desktop distribution for advanced Linux users.
* [[OpenGEU]] is an Ubuntu based distribution with Enlightenment window manager, previously known as Geubuntu.
* [[OpenGEU]] is an Ubuntu based distribution with Enlightenment window manager, previously known as Geubuntu.
  +
* [[OzOS]], Focused on [[Enlightenment_(window_manager)|Enlightenment]], e17, compiled directly from CVS source. Easy update of e17 is made from CVS updates, by click an icon or from CLI using morlenxus script.
* [http://www.techm4sters.org/ Protech] is a specially designed Linux distribution for security technicians and programmers.
* [http://www.techm4sters.org/ Protech] is a specially designed Linux distribution for security technicians and programmers.
* ''[http://www.whatwouldjesusdownload.com/christianubuntu/2006/07/about-ubuntu-christian-edition.html Ubuntu Christian Edition]'' (also referred to as Ubuntu CE) is a distribution designed for [[Christian]]s. The first version of Ubuntu Christian Edition was announced on 24 July 2006.<ref name="uces1st">[http://www.whatwouldjesusdownload.com/christianubuntu/news/blog.html Ubuntu Christian Edition news]</ref> Ubuntu Christian Edition features fully integrated web content parental controls powered by [[DansGuardian]], as well as a graphical tool to adjust the parental control settings specifically developed for Ubuntu Christian Edition, and includes several popular Bible Study Programs such as [[GnomeSword]].
* ''[http://www.whatwouldjesusdownload.com/christianubuntu/2006/07/about-ubuntu-christian-edition.html Ubuntu Christian Edition]'' (also referred to as Ubuntu CE) is a distribution designed for [[Christian]]s. The first version of Ubuntu Christian Edition was announced on 24 July 2006.<ref name="uces1st">[http://www.whatwouldjesusdownload.com/christianubuntu/news/blog.html Ubuntu Christian Edition news]</ref> Ubuntu Christian Edition features fully integrated web content parental controls powered by [[DansGuardian]], as well as a graphical tool to adjust the parental control settings specifically developed for Ubuntu Christian Edition, and includes several popular Bible Study Programs such as [[GnomeSword]].
